title: Practical Implementation of Transfer Learning and Data Augmentation for Medical Image Classification

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Understanding of Machine Learning, Experience in Python Programming, and Basic Concepts of Neural Network Structures
context.additional_context: Practical training on applying image classification technology to medical data. Strengthening model development competencies using transfer learning and data augmentation in limited-data environments

learning_goals: ResNet50 and VGG-16 models can be applied to medical image classification.
Transfer learning model performance using an SVM classifier can be improved by over 95%.
Data scarcity issues can be resolved by implementing image preprocessing (noise removal, contrast enhancement) and data augmentation techniques.
Model performance can be objectively evaluated through k-fold cross-validation.
The classification system development process using medical image datasets (e.g., ISIC 2017) can be explained.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
